name: David Butler
bio:
celebrating a God who is good 💛
believing in a world that is rad 🌍
more good news @goodnewsbrandco 
weekly podcast @dontmissthisstudy

social_posts.post_text:
the way we view someone dictates the way we respond to them
.
so what about God 
.
is He one we run and hide from?
.
if so…what is it that we believe about Him that would cause us to respond and reply in that way?
.
one of the purposes of scripture is to repaint the character and heart of God 
.
to correct whatever lie the devil has told 
.
and show us who He really is 
.
and that correct view will change the way we respond

i kind of look forward to them every year
.
and i have a bin of them on the christmas decorations shelf in the garage
.
a whole tin full of santa ornaments with their pictures for the face, christmas trees out of popsicle sticks, and cards made with glue and glitter 
.
it’s the same for every holiday
.
homemade gifts 
.
and i genuinely love getting them
.
not because i wanted or needed them
.
but because of how proud the kids faces beam when they give them to me
.
because if i’m being honest, they are actually quite horrible
.
the opposite of fine art
.
they are crooked
.
outside the lines
.
falling apart 
.
they are not well made at all
.
but the kids love them!
.
and they are beyond thrilled to give them
.
see…something happens when we grow up
.
we lose that
.
we lose the ability to give or offer something that isn’t perfect 
.
we throw it away 
.
or start over 
.
or get too embarrassed to show it 
.
and the problem is, it isn’t the problem at all
.
it’s a symptom of the problem
.
the problem of living by the standard of perfection 
.
the standard that says, unless it is flawless, then it is wrong and useless 
.
but Jesus gives us a new way to live
.
a new standard 
.
living by the standard of grace 
.
to live in a way where perfection is a hope but not an expectation or demand
.
where perfection doesn’t even mean flawless, but whole, complete, finished 
.
made whole, rather 
.
and made whole eventually
.
living by a standard of grace gives us permission to fail 
.
it makes mistakes the expectation
.
not the exception
.
we plan on needing grace 
.
we welcome the thought of it
.
mostly because Grace is a person
.
a person we can hand a crooked, outside the lines gift to
.
and His eyes light up and His face beams when we offer it 
.
not because it is perfect
.
but because it is given from us 
.
the very best we could
.
homemade
.
but given in love

the more unobtainable a gift is, the better it is
.
that’s what makes Jesus the greatest gift of all
.
the most unobtainable, and yet the most freely given

right after i said it i realized i didn’t believe it
.
at least not any more
.
it was saturday morning 
.
chore time
.
the most wonderful time of the year 
.
and absolutely no one in the household is capable of remembering that we do this every. single. saturday 
.
so the mom voice had to come out 
.
and then the dad voice did because they are immune to the mom one 
.
and i used my age old “november through december discipline method”
.
the santa threat 
.
because he knows if they’ve been bad or good at doing their jobs
.
and that’s when i realized it 
.
that i owe santa an apology
.
because i’ve been branding him wrong 
.
you see…i’ve been telling the kids that santa brings them gifts if they are good
.
that his generosity was based off of “their” actions instead of “his” heart
.
and i realized i was just using him to avoid the emotional intensity it takes to actually parent 
.
the easy way out
.
and so i rebranded him 
.
and started telling a better truth 
.
that santa doesn’t bring gifts because the kids are good…but because he is 
.
and in the rebranding i realized i may have believed wrong for a while about God too
.
that He was the same 
.
coming only when we are good
.
instead of just letting Him be good independent of what i choose to do
.
and yes, yes, there are certainly privileges and experiences to life and relationships that we can receive and enjoy in degrees because of how we live our lives and the choices we make 
.
but mere mortals cannot manipulate the goodness and grace of God 
.
we can receive it, and recognize it and request it 
.
but He is not generous because we are good
.
but because He is
.
He is, and was, and will always be just as good and kind
.
and perhaps particularly more to those who don’t deserve it 
.
so today i am rebranding santa 
.
and you can too if you want
.
(unless you have an ornery six year old, because then you are allowed to use any method you can or want to simply survive! you can fix it later)
.
but if you don’t do it with santa, at least do it with God
.
who doesn’t need a rebrand, but perhaps needs a rethinking and remembering about who He really is 
.
good
.
no matter which list i am on

we want christmas to be perfect
.
and we are upset if it isn’t 
.
but the first christmas was anything but perfect 
.
and it was still holy

i think my heart may have broke into 100 pieces when i heard the news 
.
the father of a family that i adore more than i have words to paint, tragically passed away 
.
a terrible, unexpected loss for this whole community 
.
for this whole world really
.
he was one of the good ones 
.
you would know that by the way the church was spilling over with people the night of his viewing 
.
as i was leaving that night i passed by some friends who were there mourning with those who mourn 
.
knowing i am a person of faith, one of them simply asked out loud what 1000 others were also asking that night—“where is the answer for this one brother butler?”
.
i can’t remember what i said 
.
maybe nothing 
.
these kind of things leave you without reasons and words
.
but as i walked out into the cold my heart caught the answer 
.
Jesus
.
the answer for it is Jesus 
.
i know she was wondering about the why
.
the reason
.
the answer to the unfair 
.
but God whispered another kind of answer 
.
the answer to “now what?”
.
i don’t have the wisdom of heaven to sort out the ins and outs of miracle and tragedy 
.
i don’t know the why or the reason 
.
i don’t know the cause 
.
but i know where to turn
.
the answer is Jesus 
.
in times of tragedy, He is the answer
.
in times of tears, He is the answer
.
in times of need or want or loss, He is the answer
.
He isn’t the answer for “why”
.
but He will be the answer for “why they make it through”
.
He didn’t make it happen
.
but He can make it better
.
He is the answer to the problem
.
He is the answer for healing 
.
the answer for peace 
.
He is where they will go for grace 
.
for companionship 
.
for someone who understands
.
and who will listen
.
He will settle their hearts 
.
He will put the broken pieces back together 
.
He will bring beauty from these ashes 
.
and one day He will make it up to them
.
and He will wipe away every tear
.
i don’t know why these things happen 
.
there will be so much unknown here earth side 
.
but even before we know, Jesus is the answer

dear world,
.
you might consider adding one more thing to your christmas list 
.
the chance to get to know jenny 
.
and as good as you may have made her in your imagination 
.
she will pass it up the moment you hear her say hello 
. 
she just gets more golden with every year 
.
happy birthday darling girl 
.
i am the luckiest 
.
💛💛💛

i have heard it one hundred times this month 
.
maybe you too
.
it’s the classic small talk december lingo 
.
“are you ready for christmas?”
.
i’m not sure what it means when people ask
.
but i think most are wondering if i have all my gifts picked out and wrapped for the 900 children that live with us
.
i usually match their cliche with cliche, “ready or not” and then fake laugh
.
but inside i rack my mind with stress that i forgot the “fun” gift for child number five
.
or the oranges
.
or the right lego set
.
or where i hid jenny’s gift cause why don’t i just write it down
.
or whether everyone is “even” because they are old enough now to look around with that competitive stink eye on christmas morning
.
am i ready?
.
no...
.
but amazon prime yo
.
God bless
.
but that question has got me thinking 
.
thinking about the spontaneity and un-readiness of the first christmas
.
i like it
.
mary goes into labor unexpectedly
.
joseph scrambles to find clean hay
.
shepherds were woken up in the middle of the night
.
angels come without invitation
.
and wise men show up far beyond fashionably late
.
they totally missed the party
.
by a year!
.
a party, by the way, that someone forgot to book a room for in the first place
.
what a scene it must have been
.
and yet... 
.
and yet it all worked out
.
beautifully in fact
.
picture worthy
song writing worthy
celebration worthy
.
not because it all went according to plan
.
or because everyone was ready
.
but because there was love.
and there was purpose. 
and there was family. 
and there was Jesus.
.
and that’s really why it worked out.
.
in every nativity scene on mantles or bookshelves or piano tops...
.
no matter how mismatched and rearranged all the camels and sheep and joseph’s broken staff are...
.
right in the middle of the mess is a baby in the hay
.
and that is why it feels ok
.
better than ok
.
i think i should leave that reminder out all year
.
of a baby who turned a stable into heaven
.
One who can do the same with whatever i have 
.
ready or not

some words are only happy words 
.
ice cream
.
christmas
.
kangaroo
.
others live on the dark side of the force
.
taxes
.
potty training 
.
bee stings
.
but some are both 
.
and they spark polar emotions 
.
one of those is “new”
.
new is either super exciting, or crowded with fear 
.
it’s a tipping word 
.
which makes “new years” a tipping moment 
.
i can feel my heart swaying between the two today
.
eager anticipation for the unknown
.
unwelcome anxiety for the same
.
which is why i am gripping onto a name of Jesus and some of His advice as i count down to midnight 
.
the name is new for me
.
the good kind of new
.
it is one i discovered this last year in the pages of the old testament 
.
it’s one i was familiar with
.
probably His most familiar name from those pages
.
Jehovah
.
but the new definition is what i’m holding onto
.
one way to translate the holy name of Jehovah is “I will be what tomorrow demands”
.
as i step into the unknown tomorrow, there is only one thing i can be certain of 
.
and it’s the one thing i would choose
.
Him
.
that whatever tomorrow demands or delivers, He will be there 
.
with “mercies new every morning” (lamentations 3:22-23)
.
He is my only guarantee 
.
and He will be whatever the new demands 
.
and when i find Him there, it will be with this advice 
.
spoken in a moment of fear and great joy to His disciples 
.
a tipping moment 
.
“ Let not your heart be troubled (neither let it be afraid) : ye believe in God, believe also in me” (john 14:1,27)
.
“let not your heart”
.
as if He sees the swaying 
.
as if He recognizes the choice your heart has to make
.
as if He sees where it could easily go, and offers this alternative instead
.
choose to believe 
.
choose to dream
.
choose to live by the rhythm of His presence
.
let not your heart flirt with fear 
.
let it celebrate and hope and wish
.
let it embrace the good
.
let it embrace the anticipation 
.
let it embrace miracles
.
let it embrace God 
.
for He will be there 
.
and will meet you with whatever goals or worries or visions you bring with you
.
there for whatever tomorrow demands
.
and for whatever tomorrow dreams up too
.
cheers to a happy new year friend
.
let it be so

i hope it’s not too late 
.
but it might be
.
cause if you are anything like me, you throw things away after christmas like a banshee 
.
so you might have already tossed your christmas cards 
.
(even though i consider it slightly brutal to throw away pictures of your friends…but you do you)
.
but if you still have them…maybe you want to join us in one of our favorite christmas traditions 
.
we put all of our cards together in a basket, then each week we choose one out of the deck 
.
one card, any card
.
and then we pray for that family for that entire week
.
by name 
.
and call down heaven’s finest blessings for them
.
protection 
.
strength
.
grace
.
presence 
.
whatever they need 
.
i adore this tradition
.
it’s our way of staying connected to those we love
.
and connected to the friends of the people who used to live at our house that we are still getting cards for
.
lucky them i guess
.
anyways…give it a try if you want
.
and if you happen to notice a little extra sparkle during one of these coming weeks…maybe we picked your card 💛

some of you will remember, but for those of who may be unaware 
.
back in the ancient times (as jack calls my childhood)
.
when i was little 
.
we had no cell phones or find my friends or anything like that (although i had a beeper my senior year, so ya)
.
so when you went places you had to make so many more arrangements 
.
how to find people, when to meet, what to do if you split up…
.
during one of those dark ages, my family took a trip to disneyland 
.
and when we went into the park, one of the first things we did was establish a meeting place in case anyone got lost 
.
our family’s meeting place was the statue of mickey 
.
the big one of him and walt holding hands up front 
.
my parents told us if we ever got separated to go there and that is where they would come find us 
.
meet us at mickey 
.
i always felt safe in the crowded park knowing that no matter what, i had a place to go if something went wrong 
.
this was the memory i thought of when i read the most darling story someone sent me 
.
she was tucking her little one into bed 
.
and like littles do, he asked his mom one of those questions you just wonder where they got it from 
.
“mom…when we die and go to heaven, how are we going to find each other?”
.
we need a meeting place
.
the mom hesitated, wondering how to answer such a random, but sweet question 
.
but she didn’t need to
.
cause her little figured it out before she had the chance 
.
oh i know…
.
we will just meet at Jesus
.
meet me at Jesus
.
i’ve not stopped thinking about that phrase ever since 
.
i just love it 
.
meet me at Jesus 💛
.
if you are lost 
.
or afraid 
.
or hurting 
.
meet me at Jesus 
.
if you are confused 
.
or wandering 
.
or wondering 
.
meet me at Jesus 
.
if you are unsure 
.
or lonely
.
or worn out 
.
meet me at Jesus 
.
there is a place we all have to go
.
a person we all have to go to
.
One who will be constant 
.
and kind
.
and easy to find 
.
however our journeys or adventures may look
.
whatever the surprises the next hour may bring 
.
no matter what may go wrong in this crowded world of strangers
.
we can be sure
.
there is always somewhere to go 
.
meet me at Jesus

i wish everyone could’ve seen it 
.
but the problem is most people don’t 
.
because their eye is on the bride
.
as it probably should be
.
it isn’t hard for her to steal the show 
.
but i sat in the church seats today
.
and my attention was on the groom 
.
he is the one i knew better 
.
and i’ve been one so…
.
and as i watched
.
there was a moment 
.
the kind that thumps the heart 
.
i didn’t even need to look at the back of the room 
.
or listen to the familiar song
.
because i knew she had walked in 
.
it was all in his eyes 
.
and i wanted everyone to see it 
.
the way a boy looks at his bride to be 
.
with the most loyal and adoring eyes 
.
with faith and tenderness 
.
a sparkle you don’t see many other places 
.
it’s unmatched 
.
and it made me remember something my dad said to me
.
when i asked him what he thought about me proposing to jenny 
.
he quoted paul 
.
if you can love her, the way Christ loves His church…then you are ready 
.
and it made me think today 
.
about why He calls the church His bride 
.
because the way He looks at her 
.
with those loyal and adoring eyes 
.
and promises to love her in all faith and tenderness 
.
for His love is patient
.
it is kind 
.
it’s not easily angered
.
it always protects
.
always hopes
.
always trusts 
.
and endures all things 
.
and never fails 
.
and you would be able to tell the moment she walked into the room 
.
oh i wish you could see the way He sees you
.
it’s unmatched

i think what God hopes is not what He demands 
.
i believe He can do amazing things with a life
.
incredible things 
.
but He can do amazing and incredible things with whatever you are ready and willing to give
.
it’s tough to hand your heart over to someone 
.
it takes a lot of courage 
.
God knows that 
.
He is ok with that 
.
and He is in the business of winning hearts 
.
not forcing them

you may hate me for bringing this up 
.
but it was too good of a line not to
.
i know the counter is clear 
.
and christmas is cleaned
.
and you want to forget all the neighbor treats you ate simply because they were there 
.
sorry to remind you of how low things got
.
but again…the line is worth it
.
on the radio a lady was talking about favorite holiday treats 
.
and she kinda surprised me when she said that hers was fruitcake
.
i don’t think i’ve ever even had fruitcake
.
i kinda thought it was made up 
.
a gross christmas make believe 
.
but she talked about it like it was gold
.
the memories of making it with her grandma 
.
picking the fruits…mixing the batter 
.
how the smell of it coming out of the oven always takes her back to happier days 
.
and honestly, she almost persuaded me to believe in it
.
to try it for my first time 
.
to like it even
.
the radio host even tread lightly because of how fondly she talked 
.
but she finally said—“you know that fruitcake is sorta the joke of christmas right?”
.
the lady on the other line laughed a warm southern laugh 
.
“oh i know…and maybe that’s i why i like it. cause no one else will”
.
the radio host said back—i like you! 
.
you root for the underdog 
.
to which my new favorite lady replied: “well…someone’s got to….
.
so i decided it should be me”
.
and she gave me my directive for the year 
.
to decide it should be me 
.
to root for the underdog 
.
to pick the one no one else will 
.
to champion the ones no one believes in
.
to speak of the jokes of the world in a way that makes others tread lightly 
.
to think fondly
.
to like 
.
it reminds me of one of my favorite chapters in scripture 
.
here is how one bible translates it:
.
“By this time a lot of men and women of questionable reputation were hanging around Jesus, listening intently. 
.
The Pharisees and religion scholars were not pleased, not at all pleased. 
.
They growled, “He takes in sinners and eats meals with them, treating them like old friends” (Luke 15 MSG)
.
the questionable…
.
like old friends…
.
like He always has
.
it’s one of the reasons i like Him 
.
He roots for the underdog
.
cause someone had to
.
so glad He decided “it should be me”

started cleaning out my pictures today on my phone, but cleaned out absolutely zero of them and spent time on memory lane instead 
.
i should buy a house on that lane 
.
in my time there i found this gem!
.
worth at least a thousand words 
.
when i was in israel back in september this darling couple came with me on the tour 
.
i found out on day one of the trip that they were waiting on a mission call 
.
they had submitted an application to go serve the Lord and were waiting on the details 
.
i prayed and prayed it would come while we were on the trip
.
cause what if you opened a mission call in the holy land???
.
and i wouldn’t be posting this if it didn’t come, so you aren’t surprised to know that when i saw them at breakfast one morning they were beaming
.
it happened to come on a day when we were scheduled to take a boat ride out onto the sea of galilee 
.
so i made them wait so they could open it out on the water 
.
we stopped the engines and let the boat rock gently and quietly 
.
and there against the backdrop of the place of miracles 
.
Jesus called again 
.
follow me, and i will make you fishers of men 
.
and once again disciples left nets 
.
nets full of grandkids and retirement and possibility 
.
and i watched and realized that God is never done 
.
He keeps calling 
.
because He just won’t give up
.
and that thrilled me enough i think i could’ve walked back to shore

somehow i got stuck with the worst job
.
i guess it’s what happens if you get there last
.
jenny got to vacuum all the hallways 
.
the children got to sleep in (cause we forgot all about it…)
.
and i got to scrub the toilets 
.
it legit required some serious mental zen work to not think about the reality of what i was cleaning
.
but i had a thought when i was taking out the garbage at the end 
.
the church is messy 
.
and by the church, i mean people
.
and because people are the church…i say again, the church is messy 
.
papers and scuff marks and half broken (or bitten) crayons 
.
crushed goldfish, chalk dust, and used sucker sticks in the hymn book slots
.
just a lot of stuff 
.
messy
.
and when i came home, my house was the same 
.
because people are messy 
.
and my home is a home because of the people 
.
when you walk in, it looks lived in 
.
evidence that people are there
.
experiencing life…together 
.
and we still clean it up
.
but it’s somehow ok
.
because if there were no mess, it would mean no people 
.
and i just wouldn’t
.
sometimes we call the church a living church 
.
and there is evidence that it’s being lived in 
.
people experiencing life…together 
.
and whenever there are people, there will always be mess
.
all good dinners have dishes 
.
and all parties have bags of trash 
.
and christmas mornings have extra boxes 
.
and weddings have burnt out sparklers 
.
and the greatest concerts and games have traffic jams 
.
if you want to bring people together, and enjoy the thrill of togetherness, there will always be mess 
.
everything has it
.
families, work, schools…
.
we have to deal with it everywhere
.
but we do, because we want the togetherness 
.
church mess is extra hard sometimes 
.
because you trust church to be something beyond this world 
.
but it’s still people 
.
and people bring mess
.
and it multiplies when they come together 
.
but i’ll take it 
.
because they don’t just bring mess
.
i want thanksgiving even if i have to load the dishwasher 
.
and i want the wedding even if i am on cleanup 
.
and i want the thrill of the church…the people…even if i have to scrub the toilets

makes sense to claim the good kids 
.
but we worship the God of Jacob
.
a God who claims us before we have everything figured out

weekends  are a gamble
.
a straight game of roulette in whether monday will come with kids liking you or not 
.
cause saturday is clean up day
.
and weekends are for resetting 
.
so there are chores 
.
and there are conversations 
.
and there are things we, as parents, implement and insist on again that we forgot we implemented and insisted on before 
.
so it ends in a coin toss
.
and i’m sad to say that there have been a fair share when we’ve landed on tails 
.
and the kids pack grudges into their backpacks monday morning 
.
and parents have to be parents they say
.
and kids are kids they say
.
but it still doesn’t take away the sad 
.
the kind that comes when your kiddos think you are against them
.
battling with them
.
as enemies
.
cause they can’t see under the hood
.
at your heart 
.
or intentions
.
and how every feeling in you is opposite of what they assume
.
and dealing with this kind of dad stuff has taught me something really valuable
.
cause i sometimes do the same with God
.
and pack my own grudges 
.
and treat Him like He is against me 
.
making my life harder on purpose 
.
like He would be into that or something
.
and not being able to see the obvious truth
.
that He is actually on my side 
.
that He is for me
.
even if life seems against me 
.
cause sometimes it’s hard to remember that my fight is not with Him
.
it’s with sin
.
and selfishness
.
and greed
.
and pride
.
and hurt
.
and loneliness 
.
and weakness
.
and unfair
.
these are my enemies
.
not Him
.
life is hard 
.
not God
.
He is not against us
.
He doesn’t want to battle with us
.
He wants so desperately to battle WITH us 
.
together
.
side by side
. 
defending
.
adoring
.
and fighting for you 
.
every day
.
and some day
.
we will all see more clearly 
.
that His love and devotion and interest in us was never a 50/50

it felt like heaven set the appointment 
.
could’ve been random
.
but i don’t like to think so
.
i had this unexpected conversation with a boy this week 
.
we had never met before 
.
i was just a stranger that happened to be there 
.
but it felt like one of God’s errands 
.
i was clumsy at best, but tried to convey the message that He put in me
.
tragedy had recently erupted in his story
.
a sucker punch of unfair 
.
heart breaking heaviness 
.
the kind that seems to easily quench hope 
.
i wished i could’ve taken some of it from him
.
it was a reminder of how much people carry under the surface 
.
of how much healing this hurt world needs
.
and i walked away thinking this:
.
someday, Jesus is coming again 
.
we need Him
.
and when He does come, He will make it up to that boy
.
He will make it all better
.
every loss made right 
.
each piece of his broken heart put back together 
.
every tear wiped from his cheek
.
i believe that with every bounce of my heart 
.
and i believe that for everyone 
.

 “meantime”

most people pass right by 
.
it’s not that it isn’t stunning 
.
maybe the artist intended it to be easy to miss
.
i think people are just anticipating or focused on something else
.
just outside the gates of the city of capaernum—the galilee town of Jesus—there is a sculpture
.
but it’s different
.
it’s a sculpture of a man lying down on a bench, wrapped in a bronzed blanket
.
his face and body are covered—shielding himself from cold…or perhaps shame—all the way down to his ankles
.
the only thing showing are his feet 
.
at a closer look, you would see nail prints in those feet
.
they call the sculpture “homeless Jesus”
.
a callout to one of His final commissions to His disciples 
.
the only spot in scripture that i know of where Jesus explains what will be most important to Him on judgment day
.
a plea to take care of the least of these 
.
when saw we thee hungered and fed thee?
or thirsty and gave thee drink?
when saw we thee a stranger, naked, or a prisoner and came unto thee?
.
and most people pass by
.
not noticing
.
hoping to find Him in the stones where He walked
.
or in the church built in His name
.
or in the music written to reach His heavens 
.
and perhaps they will
.
but the sculpture stands as a reminder of where He hopes we will see Him most often 
.
where we will find Him most easily

she went back home to get a quilt that had been made for her

she returned to the parking lot and laid it over the man

when he looked up at her in gratitude their eyes met

they shared a silent connection

tears were their only words
.
a moment and memory that inspired her next painting 
.
Jesus
.
for she had seen His face

i found a contender for my new favorite flower

.
the crocus flower is known for being the first flower to wake up for spring 
.
if you google pictures of them, you often see them growing up through snow 
.
the first sign that winter will have an end 
.
a picture of hope
.
when you see one, you almost don’t believe it 
.
because the world around you is still dark and cold 
.
but it is a promise that something new is coming 
.
that everything will be ok
.
even if it doesn’t look like it yet 
.
that’s what the empty tomb does for me 
.
it’s a sign that one day the cold and dark of this world will end 
.
that a new story is coming 
.
the world is still in winter, but Jesus gave us the promise of spring 
.
of new life
.
the victory has already been won 
.
but the change isn’t quite here yet
.
at least in its full measure 
.
but there hope to hold on to in the mean time 
.
a reassurance that no matter how things look now, one day they will be different 
.
because if death isn’t final, what else isn’t either
.
my good friend recently lost his father in an unexpected tragedy

it is a loss he will feel his whole life 
.
but his missionary brother said something at the funeral i don’t ever want to forget

he said
.
because of my dad, i know Christ lives 
and because of Christ, i know my dad does

it is still winter for him 
.
but he has the hope of spring

he has the hope of Jesus

a belief that has power to go toe to toe with death itself

the promise of the empty tomb 
.
a picture of hope
.
that everything, one day, will be ok

technicalities

less focus on the what (which is significant)

a path of companionship

a path of connection

a path of learning and loving and becoming something more

a path of correction

a path of encouragement

a path of consecration and sacrifice 
.
a path of loyalty

of forgiveness 
.
of strength 
.
a path of wisdom
.
a path of miracles

a path of grace

a path with Him

here at home

and at school

and work

and later this summer…in israel
