memories 
.
unless you want them to stay 
.
these ones i do 
.
memories of my grandma and pom pom’s house
.
i don’t know why they’ve been so front of the heart lately 
.
they just came
.
memories i treasure
.
how excited i always was to go there 
.
to be the first to the game closet
.
to find the moving maze with the little silver marble 
.
to put on the brown cowboy hat 
.
to look through the collection of bells
.
to open the little closet under the stairs and pull the string to turn on the light
.
to shoot baskets over the electric wires
.
it was way funner that way 
.
to smell the powder bin in the bathroom 
.
to watch cable (we told her my parents said it was fine to watch MTV…)
.
the crystal jam dishes
.
and of course the ice cream
.
it was always there
.
my two favorite flavors
.
every time 
.
as if it were magic 
.
there were treasures at grandma and pom pom’s house 
.
treasures unique to Indigo Lane 
.
but as i think back on all of them
.
i realize the greatest treasure of them all…
.
was them 
.
the best part about going was who opened the door
.
and stood on the porch to wave as we drove away 
.
and so it is i suppose with every important thing in this life 
.
cause i’ve been thinking a lot lately about why i follow Jesus 
.
every gift and promised grace 
.
that mansion in heaven 
.
and the blessings we are told to count 
.
but when i count them…
.
the one i start with 
.
and the one i would leave all the rest behind for 
.
it’s Him 
.
the best part about following Jesus, is Jesus 
.
i don’t need His stuff
.
and i appreciate and plead for His help
.
but those aren’t the best parts
.
He is
.
and if i do make it to that mansion in heaven 
.
it will only be heaven if He opens the door
.
and my two favorite ice creams would be a welcomed bonus 
.
as long as pom pom gets to scoop

not sure if we taught you about taxes
.
or interest rates 
.
or laundry detergent 
.
but if you are ever lost 
.
remember what we taught you about Jesus 
.
and let the compass of your heart be drawn back to Him
.
you’ll figure out the other stuff 
.
i love you jack jack
.
proud of you buddy

image_entities.entity: i choose my friends how i

social_posts.post_text:
everyone was doing it 
.
heads moving quickly back and forth 
.
pointing through the crowds
.
trying to find theirs
.
it was tough in the sea of purple robes and funny hats with tassels 
.
everyone looked the same
.
but nobody was
.
cause i wasn’t looking for “a” kid graduating 
.
i was looking for mine
.
i didn’t hold all of their hands across the street 
.
or watch blues clues for the 80th time with each of them 
.
or sit at the kitchen table cussing over their math
.
or sit in bleachers holding my breath for all of them 
.
just one of them
.
but as i looked for my one, i realized everyone else was doing the same 
.
and they each had history
.
each kid in there had been worried over, loved over, cried over, prayed over, and celebrated over 
.
over and over
.
it reminded me of a favorite story of mine 
.
one i would read at the beginning of every school year as a teacher
.
it was a story of another teacher
.
who had a boy in his class that no one wanted 
.
a boy that everyone was tempted to give up on 
.
teachers you know the one… 
.
he was frustrating and aggravating and this particular teacher used to hope he just wouldn’t come 
.
class would go so much better 
.
it came to the point of wits end
.
when the scripture that “one student should
perish so a whole class doesn’t dwindle in unbelief” came in handy 
.
and then the teacher heard a question that pierced his heart 
.
“what if he were your son?”
.
and somehow everything was different
.
and he saw a boy loved 
.
and a boy prayed over
.
and a boy who took his first breath
.
and had his first word 
.
and his first teetering steps
.
and he felt the heartbeat of heaven 
.
parents who weren’t looking for “a” kid
.
but Theirs

but where are they now?
.
it’s a question i’ve heard a lot over the years 
.
about the miracles in scripture 
.
why did so many miracles happen back then?
.
healings and rescues and all the things 
.
and are they still happening?
.
because they don’t seem to be
.
i was walking up from the dead sea a few days ago 
.
in the land of miracle stories 
.
where oceans opened
.
and bread rained from heaven
.
and water gushed forth from hidden wells 
.
and it was super clear why someone named the area dead
.
it was dry and salty and hot as hades 
.
and some say a land God has forsaken
.
someone in our group was making his way up to the top of the hill after swimming and almost collapsed
.
i think it was the jet lag plus the steep climb plus the sun deciding to come super close to earth that afternoon
.
all that left him struggling 
.
i stopped to see how he was 
.
he gasped out an “i’m ok”
.
but he didn’t really look it 
.
we found him a chair and then i said, “let me run and get you some water”
.
i hoped that was all he needed!
.
right at the moment i said that a lady passing by said “oh i have some. i happened to buy an extra one”
.
she reached into her bag and pulled out a chilled bottle of water
.
it was as if moses had struck a rock in the desert
.
and something in me said “water still gushes forth”
.
i ran up after her to pay her for the water
.
she and her husband laughed at how absurd it would be for me to pay them back
.
“when i see someone like that, i just picture my own dad and then it is instinct to help”
.
she had eyes to see
.
and i thought about He who gave them to her
.
a God who gushes still
.
and could He give those eyes to me
.
so i can see the miracles 
.
and have yet another answer to give when someone asks “where are they now”

someone smart once taught me:
all religion is a local experience 
.
so when someone says: the church is this…or the church is that…
.
what they mean is—my local congregation is this or that 
.
the church doesn’t have a culture
.
people do
.
which means people dictate what the experience is like 
.
if we want “the church” to be more loving…well then be more loving 
.
if we wish “the church” has more excitement—be more exciting 
.
if you want “the church” to start dancing in the sabbath
.
lace up your shoes 
.
you and me—we are the church

Jesus was here 
.
and so were we 
.
someone asked me today what my favorite part of my israel trip was this year 
.
easy answer:
jack
.
we danced in the sabbath
.
we rode on His stormy sea
.
we put our feet on the stones
.
we ran through the valley
.
we knelt in an olive grove
.
we walked through a miracle
.
we heard His call on a fisherman’s beach
.
we put our prayers in a wall
.
we saw an empty tomb 
.
we read His stories where they happened
.
we did it together 
.
and that was the best part

i don’t think i’ll get one this year 
.
the kids are too old (that’s kind of sadder to say than i thought it would be)
.
but i’ve had my fair share 
.
it’s a father’s day classic
.
a picture drawn in church 
.
usually on the shape of a tie
.
of them and me
.
it’s not always the picture you hoped to see 
.
a bigger belly than you want 
.
less hair than you actually have 
.
or just at work…
.
it’s always a little telling to get one 
.
to see the way they see you
.
but it got me thinking 
.
what picture would i draw of God this father’s day
.
if i had my blank tie…how do i see Him?
.
a picture does actually comes to mind 
.
it was a terrible tragedy 
.
an earthquake in eastern europe that killed 30,000 people in four minutes
.
among the survivors was a dad 
.
a dad who had a boy away at school 
.
when the earth stopped shaking he ran to the elementary school 
.
his heart sunk when all he found was a pile of rubble where the building once was
.
he immediately went to the corner where his son’s classroom was and started digging 
.
he moved cement and rebar and crushed debris with his bare hands
.
soon the fire chief came and warned him to stop 
.
it was too dangerous
.
but the dad kept digging
.
he had promised his son he would always come
.
the police tried to stop him too 
.
there was no hope they said 
.
but the dad kept digging
.
he had promised 
.
he dug and dug through the night 
.
one hour at a time
.
one piece of rubble at a time
.
for 38 hours straight that dad kept digging
.
until finally he heard a voice in the dark
.
“dad?”
.
“armand…is that you?”
.
“it’s me dad”
.
when the school collapsed, two beams formed a wedge that miraculously shielded and saved 14 of the kids
.
his son was one of them
.
and what he said next always wins me
.
“i told them you would come”
.
he had promised 
.
and the boy knew what that meant
.
he had the right picture of his dad 
.
a dad who no matter the danger
.
no matter if anyone else gave up hope
.
would keep digging 
.
and always come
.
yep…that’s the picture…

there are things that have changed and happened in this universe because someone prayed 
.
there are things that haven’t happened because someone didn’t 
.
it was what Jesus went to first 
.
prayer
.
p.s. if i tell you i’m praying for you, i actually mean it 
.
i’m praying for you
.
and i think it matters

people always say it 
.
but i don’t think it’s completely true 
.
and i promise i’m not trying to be ticky tacky 
.
(at least with this idea…cause i am not above ticky tacky)
.
i just want to give credit…
.
or rather praise 
.
where praise is due
.
i was in a conversation the other day that concluded with the “not so true” sentiment 
.
“time heals all wounds”
.
and right when it was said my heart said something different 
.
i actually think God does 
.
time doesn’t heal broken hearts, God does 
.
time just passes 
.
but God is moved with compassion 
.
and gets involved 
.
time isn’t concerned with the details 
.
and doesn’t do anything about it
.
but God does 
.
and so it is with a lot of things we might catch ourselves saying 
.
repentance doesn’t forgive sin
.
God does 
.
temples don’t sanctify us
.
God does
.
prayer and petitions don’t change things 
.
God does 
.
perhaps God needs time 
.
and certainly each of these other principles or patterns are powerful and beautiful and important
.
but because they invite Him in
.
this is just a nuance that lets you have both
.
promises aren’t as important as the person they are made with
.
and don’t forget when you go through the motion the One who actually has emotion 
.
baptism doesn’t have a beating heart 
.
God does
.
and concepts and covenants don’t save people 
.
and they don’t love people 
.
and they don’t cry for and create for and care for people 
.
but God does… 
.
every time

it would be easy to read His words in a threatening tone
.
but it wasn’t a threat
.
it was a warning 
.
He is not out to punish 
.
He came to protect

they were pretty strict about it 
.
and adamant it should be done a certain way
.
but i had christian with me
.
the kid who got my “probably gonna do it my own way” dna 
.
so right now we have a new temple being built near our house 
.
before temples are set apart and dedicated for special use, they are open to the public for a few months to give everyone a chance to see inside 
.
hundreds of thousands of people come through 
.
it’s like a holy parade of homes
.
yesterday our family volunteered as ushers for the open house 
.
for part of our shift, christian and i were the doormen for the celestial room
.
the celestial room is the showstopper for the tour
.
it is decked from floor to ceiling with fancy 
.
a place that is meant to symbolize the presence of God
.
heaven
.
and it really does give that vibe 
.
especially yesterday 
.
because it was full to the brim
.
with people of every kind
.
our job was to open the door for everyone to come in
.
our instructions were clear and specific though
.
only open the door to a 90 degree angle 
.
sticking straight out 
.
we only had to do it once to know it was wrong 
.
too narrow
.
christian said it best
.
this feels like a handshake 
.
i want to open them up so it feels like a hug 
.
wide
.
so that’s what we did 
.
as wide as they would go
.
we got in trouble for it 
.
but that’s how it goes sometimes
.
just different than what everyone is used to
.
they wanted the doors to only open a little so they could shut quickly so it would be quiet in there 
.
which i get…
.
but i said to christian—today, welcoming is more important than quiet
.
to make sure everyone know they have a place inside 
.
and once they are in there, God will do the rest 
.
He will comfort, counsel, and correct, and convince 
.
in the way He knows best 
.
in a timing they both feel comfortable with
.
but that’s not my job
.
mine is the footman 
.
not the filter
.
the butler
.
the door boy
.
opening them up as wide as they can go
.
a big wide welcoming hug

we were sitting right behind home plate
.
it’s where i’ve spent most of the summer so far
.
day after day at the ball park
.
the bleachers aren’t comfortable 
.
but the nachos make up for it 
.
the ball park was bustling like usual 
.
four games were happening at once 
.
the yells of umpires
.
the cheers of crowds
.
the occasional overanxious fan that needs to settle down 
.
the roll of scooter wheels and impromptu games of tag zipping through the pathways
.
i didn’t realize how loud it was until she said it
.
my friend
.
she held up her hand to pause the conversation and said “i think that is milo”
.
“you think what is milo” i wondered
.
she hopped up and was gone for a few minutes before coming back with her little guy in tow 
.
it was milo 
.
“i thought i heard his whimper”
.
then as he continued she stooped down and said “i’m here”
.
that’s when i started to pay attention to the surroundings 
.
that’s when i was wildly impressed 
.
that’s when i learned the lesson
.
among all the noise?
.
with everything going on she could pick out his faint cry for help
.
it reminded me of the wild sea
.
when Jesus was asleep
.
and the waves were crashing and the floorboards creaking and the thunder was cracking 
.
and He slept right through it all
.
didn’t even notice
.
but the second one of His dear ones called His name…He was awake
.
and available
.
He heard them
.
among all the noise
.
the faint cry for help
.
it couldn’t have been louder than a whisper compared to the storm
.
and that’s the kind of God i believe in
.
One unbothered by the fierce weather 
.
but concerned about a cry
.
One within whispering distance 
.
available
.
always close enough to hear
.
and ready with a listening ear
.
and a tender heart
.
for you to pour out 
.
frustrations 
.
worries
.
hurt
.
no matter how loud or busy or bustling the world seems 
.
He remains close enough to hear you 
.
and close enough to grab your hand and whisper back
.
and even if He doesn’t say “it’s over”
.
or “i fixed it”
.
at least He will say
.
“I’m here”

it was fun to hear everyone’s answer 
.
and it would be fun to hear yours too
.
cause it’s one of my favorite things to talk about 
.
we were sitting around with friends this weekend wondering when Jesus would come again 
.
and everyone was giving their guesses
.
five years 
.
fifty maybe 
.
tomorrow hopefully 
.
it’s one of my favorite things to talk about 
.
and it really got me thinking 
.
wondering what it will be like
.
dreaming and hoping for the good things to come
.
and it made me think 
.
what am i waiting for?
.
cause i think i actually saw it this week
.
maybe it looks like late night marble games
.
or ice cream covered faces
.
or the giggles at the dinner table 
.
or sitting under the stars with new friends 
.
maybe heaven is already breaking forth upon us
.
maybe it is here
.
for a long time i talked about “going” to heaven someday 
.
leaving this earth and going somewhere new
.
but it seems like Jesus taught heaven was coming here 
.
that it’s closer than we thought 
.
that it is already moving and growing among us
.
and maybe instead of trying to get to heaven
.
or waiting for it 
.
i should start enjoying it 
.
and creating it more
.
and when He does come again 
.
and brings more heaven with Him
.
in full measure
.
we will recognize it 
.
because we lived it
.
today 
.
as if He already came

i skip right over the things you are supposed to say 
.
when someone asks why i like christmas 
.
i go right to it 
.
gifts 
.
presents. ribbons. stockings. bows
.
it’s my favorite part 
.
and i really do like getting them 
.
fine..not as much as giving them*
.
but as i’ve grown older 
.
and my realization has awakened
.
i’ve decided what i love most
.
is watching my kids open theirs 
.
which is exactly what happened last night 
.
when i sat front row to the love of God 
.
and watched Him do what He does best
.
give gifts 
.
this time to my son
.
who was himself a gift to me
.
and wash him with blessing
.
and anoint my boy with power 
.
and quite literally wrap him up in promise 
.
my heart says thank you to a God who has been so good to me 
.
but it sings when i see how good He is to those who hold the VIP spots in my soul 
.
i am humbled to be such a recipient 
.
i am honored to be welcomed into such covenant bliss
.
i shout hallelujah to Him who gives so liberally 
.
this is at the top of why i choose to live restored Christianity
.
a descendant and heir in the house of Israel 
.
“And we ask thee, Holy Father, that thy servants may go forth from this house armed with thy power, and that thy name may be upon them, and thy glory be round about them, and thine angels have charge over them”

it’s totally my fault 
.
i passed on the gene
.
we stopped by the gas station last week for some road trip snacks and i’m lucky i’m still not there 
.
because the amount of hours it took for the kids to choose a snack were more than the hours needed to drive 
.
and i’m not mad
.
i promise
.
cause i get it
.
i take my time too
.
it happens everywhere
.
buying cars
.
movie snacks
.
menus
.
netflix 
.
i get paralyzed by a choice sometimes 
.
and it takes me a while to decide 
.
it is music to my ear when someone says 
.
“take your time”
.
it’s a symphony when they actually mean it 
.
and if i have a hard time picking between a reese’s shake or raspberry one, just imagine what the choices that actually matter do to me 
.
it’s one of the reasons i adore God 
.
because of His patient heart 
.
especially with kids like me
.
and one thing i’ve learned is
.
God is ok with a slow surrender 
.
He has asked for my heart 
.
but He lets me take my time 
.
it’s a big decision after all 
.
and so He waits 
.
and persuades 
.
and stands by 
.
and on those days i get anxious with myself 
.
or with the timing of others’ choices 
.
i remember i am a person who believes in forever 
.
and a God who is ok to wait 
.
life is kind of a road trip after all

it’s an easy time of night to go to worst case scenario 
.
especially when you get woken up so suddenly
.
“dad! dad! come here! hurry!”
.
jack was shaking me awake
.
i jolted up
.
cause was the car being stolen?
.
was the house on fire??
.
and what time is it even??
.
i followed him into my office
.
and he held up a small manila package right next to his mile wide grin 
.
“it came!”
.
his excited fingers scrambled to get it open 
.
i was still wondering what time it was
.
and relieved we had all our cars 
.
then he pulled out a small black piece of plastic 
.
his missionary tag
.
it had come in the mail sometime yesterday, but jack didn’t find it until late that night 
.
i didn’t even know he had been checking every day for it
.
christmas in july 
.
for him and me 
.
anticipation in his heart 
.
sweet memories in mine
.
it thrilled me how excited he was to get it 
.
i remember getting mine and putting it on for the first time 
.
it felt official 
.
the real deal 
.
as the days passed though, it started to mean something more 
.
cause the more i looked down 
.
or saw it in the mirror 
.
the more i saw Him 
.
Jesus on my heart 
.
marked by His name 
.
no only an ambassador of His love
.
but labeled by what He had done 
.
i was a walking billboard of His grace 
.
as i put it on each morning i was putting on a reminder of His gifts
.
Forgiven
.
Known
.
Remembered
.
Seen
.
Chosen
.
Adored
.
Free
.
the hardest day of my mission was taking that tag off for the last time 
.
but i didn’t have to take off Jesus 
.
just the black plastic tag
.
that i still have…
.
as a reminder of what i learned as i wore it 
.
and of what jack gets to teach everyone he meets 
.
that they can have Jesus on their heart too
.
go tell the world you lucky boy
.
they will want to know that 
.
any time of day or night 
.
but afternoons are probably best

when i have read that story 
.
of those boys on the mountainside
.
gathered with Jesus for their last goodbyes 
.
i don’t think i ever realized 
.
that they had fished together 
.
got into a little trouble together
.
laughed together
.
played a little backyard wiffle together 
.
grown up and grown close together 
.
and then Jesus must have looked at each of them
.
loved them
.
and said—what you have here is heaven on earth
.
don’t keep this kind of stuff to yourself 
.
everyone outta have it
.
go tell the world boys
.
and when He went up 
.
He left them with a promise 
.
a blessing
.
and each other
.
and then they must’ve huddled together just like this
.
on the edge of something breathtaking
.
and felt the strength that time and distance couldn’t dilute 
.
and one of them prayed 
.
and each of them felt it was true 
.
what Jesus had said
.
that when two or three or thirteen of you are gathered in my name 
.
there i will be also 
.
i don’t think i realized that’s how it happened 
.
until i saw it sunday night
.
and heard the prayer 
.
and the witness they shared with each other
.
to my boys on the mountainside…(the ones there and the ones not pictured)
.
i prayed you into my son’s life
.
and into mine
.
you know now where your strength comes from 
.
and don’t forget to thank Him
.
for the two or three He gave you 
.
so you could have Him near

i was wearing my checkered vans 
.
city slicker… 
.
but jack was in his full getup
.
boots and hat and big old buckle 
.
sitting on the horse 
.
he has gone full cowboy and wanted to learn roping this morning 
.
so i went along for the ride 
.
my job was to run the chute
.
so i opened the gates and giddy-upped the steer along and tried not to get “you know what” on the vans i shouldn’t have worn 
.
the cowboy who runs the ranch came over to say hello and show me what to do
.
then he warned me
.
“careful david. you spend too much time around these parts and you’ll hear and say words you didn’t know you had in you.”
.
“words that will get yourself out of heaven”
.
we laughed and he went to put the dog away 
.
as the morning went on, i started to believe him less and less 
.
mostly cause of what i saw 
.
but also cause of what i heard
. 
the words
.
“can you show him how to do that the right way. it’s funner the right way”
.
“come over here i don’t want you to get hurt”
.
“when someone makes a mistake, don’t be quick to forget about their strengths”
.
“i’m an hour and a half late, but i’m determined to help him get this”
.
friends…i believe that old cowboy was wrong
.
cause i just had church at the chutes 
.
discipleship 
.
compassion 
.
grace
.
sacrifice 
.
that’s what i heard this morning 
.
fancy bible words translated to cowboy 
.
it made me remember something my friend said to me once standing there in the dirt 
.
“whenever you get bucked off, even if it was your own fault, it’s ok…
.
you just dust yourself off, get back on the horse and ride again”
.
those might sound like cowboy words 
.
but those are Jesus words
.
words He would’ve said around those parts 
.
words He did 
.
the Word Himself
.
words that get you into heaven

when the little boy handed him his lunch
.
it wasn’t much 
.
but Jesus wasn’t disappointed
.
the offering was easy to love 
.
because He loved the one offering it

not sure if this is how it works 
.
but i’ve stored up so many hours of church these last few months 
.
i think i can take september off 
.
so many of jack’s friends (our adopted boys) are leaving on missions, so we have been church hopping for the last several weeks to hear them speak 
.
(and more to come…i might take off the rest of 2023 by the time this is over)
.
and honestly, i’ve loved every minute of it 
.
especially when they give their “why”
.
their reason for going 
.
the thing they feel called to
.
i’ve been thinking about what one of them said for days 
.
cause it knocked me right in the center
.
“i can’t wait to go out on my mission—to love people, teach people…and bring happy to their heart”
.
to bring happy to their heart…
.
are you kidding me?
.
i keep thinking about it over and over 
.
someone spread that line everywhere
.
we all need it 
.
because it’s not just a mission statement for two years in brazil 
.
it will be his purpose until the end 
.
all ours 
.
today and tomorrow and more
.
i thought of each of my kids starting school this week 
.
and the lonely ones they will pass in the hall
.
and the ones who are carrying hurt unseen 
.
and the ones who have hope draining 
.
almost on empty 
.
they will be there at school 
.
and they are in the carpool line 
.
and the cereal aisle
.
and in my contact list 
.
and sitting on a bench at the gym
.
and sometimes it is me
.
a heart that needs happy
.
it’s why Jesus came
.
and it’s why God sent us too 
.
on a mission 
.
with that “why”
.
to bring happy to their heart 
.
at home and school and play 
.
and church…
.
guess i’ll go after all
.
even this september

i know you aren’t dying 
.
but your life still flashed before my eyes 
.
i remember the doctor putting you into my hands
.
and imagining it was God putting you there 
.
into my hands
.
to watch out for
.
and keep alive
.
and then show you how to really live
.
in the good way
.
all those memories filled my heart right up to the brim
.
and then it spilled over down my cheek
.
being a missionary was the second greatest thrill of my life
.
being your dad has been the first
.
go tell the world my boy 
.
about the good stuff
.
about Jesus 
.
wish i could go with you…
.
but He will
.
and i’m ok with that
.
i’ll just read the emails 
.
He put you into my hands first 
.
and i’m just putting you back into His 
.
love you jack jack

jenny might not let me 
.
but i might not tell her 
.
which is also not a good idea
.
but i want to do the running of the bulls
.
i don’t know why, but i’ve always felt like i can’t leave this earth without doing it
.
and doing it might be the way i actually leave the earth
.
but i’m so drawn to it
.
and a good friend of mine just did it 
.
like legit wore the red bandana and white outfit and ran through the cobblestone streets with real life bulls 
.
with horns
.
and i’m so jealous 
.
and we sat at our kitchen table the other night and watched all the videos of it 
.
and now i want to do it more 
.
even though he showed us the video where he toppled 
.
and had a full size bull leap over his head 
.
inches from a hospital stay in spain 
.
(wonder what the hospital food is like there…)
.
and as we talked about it he said something that i will use in my own run next year 🤞🏼
.
“i fell because i looked back”
.
those are the people who get hurt 
.
i guess they tell you that single rule when you run
.
don’t look back 
.
and that’s great advice 
.
not just for bulls
.
because some look back in fond memory
.
but others in fear that i messed it all up
.
or regret
.
or shame
.
but that was yesterday 
.
and God and goodness and grace are today
.
and tomorrow 
.
and if i keep looking back at what should’ve and would’ve and could’ve, i’ll miss what shall and will and can 
.
and i’ve always believed He cares more about where we are headed 
.
and the direction we are facing 
.
than where we are on the path 
.
or when we got on it
.
it’s time to move on 
.
learn from it 
.
but don’t live in it 
.
and don’t look back 
.
look forward to something
.
like a new day one
.
or the thrill of what God has next 
.
and the life you can begin new
.
or perhaps a trip to spain

i didn’t want him to fix it 
.
so i said nothing 
.
because the mistake was better than what he meant 
.
and…he didn’t know i was listening through the door 
.
so there is that…
.
so when jack was starting his church mission he spent most of the first days on zoom in his bedroom 
.
i bet he thought he was done with good old zoom…
.
well one day i just cracked open his door because i overheard he was teaching someone 
.
and i wanted to hear what he would say 
.
it sounded like he was just getting started 
.
introducing himself 
.
and i heard this: 
.
“i am a representation of Jesus Christ”
.
a representation?
.
at first i laughed at how cute it was 
.
but just quietly (cause…spy) 
.
cause i know what he meant to say 
.
representative 
.
a delegate 
.
an ambassador 
.
a messenger sent forth 
.
it’s what most people say
.
but what he said was better 
.
so i said nothing 
.
because that’s what i want him to be 
.
His representation 
.
and i want that for me too
.
and for all my kids 
.
i think it’s actually what God intended back in Eden 
.
when He made us to be in His image
.
not just with faces and hands and feet 
.
but to be a walking and talking picture of His heart 
.
the unveiling of the goodness of God whenever they enter a room 
.
when they hug someone, i want others to feel wrapped up in heaven
.
when they smile i want others to see the twinkle of God’s sweet eyes 
.
when they speak i want their words to bandage broken hearts 
.
to encourage as a reflex 
.
and love bigger than expected 
.
and pour out forgiveness, benefit of the doubt, and unfailing loyalty
.
like He would do
.
like He does 
.
through His representations
.
wherever we are 
.
in mozambique or in third period math
.
leaving people more familiar with Him 
.
and fond of Him
.
when they only saw us 
.
or just met us
.
or overheard us through the crack in the door

poor jenny 
. 
every time we go on a trip somewhere i make her go into every church 
.
like all of them
.
i can’t help it
.
i just love old churches
.
and when i walk in i have to touch the walls 
.
it’s a little hippy, i know, but it is a thing 
.
cause what if they really could talk
.
the walls
.
they hold the echoes of so many prayers 
.
every heart song they have heard through the centuries 
.
praise
.
petition
.
pleading
.
and to add mine to theirs is magic to me 
.
we were in a small european city once 
.
and i was doing my wall thing in an old stone church 
.
and as i walked along i came to a stained glass window low enough to touch
.
i started tracing my hand along the black borders between the pieces of glass
.
some were big 
.
others small
.
straight edges
.
some oddly shaped 
.
the irregular bubble patterns inside 
.
and of course every kind of color 
.
each one so different 
.
but one thing was the same 
.
all broken 
.
pieces you would’ve passed as thrown away on the side of a street somewhere 
.
but when i backed up i saw something else 
.
that is something perspective does
. 
i saw a picture of Jesus 
.
a beauty made of broken pieces 
.
and i remembered what He can do with brokenness 
.
with the broken pieces of our lives 
.
and communities 
.
and churches 
.
and relationships 
.
and hearts 
.
the sharp parts
.
shattered edges
.
dropped or damaged
.
put together again
.
all made whole
.
made holy
.
people and circumstances and life…they can be harsh 
.
even in the walls of a church
.
and relationships and hearts are fragile 
.
and they break
.
so if something has broken recently
.
on purpose or not 
.
remember what He can do with the pieces
.
each of them 
.
each of us 
.
put back together 
.
in a way that reflects His love and heart that it couldn’t have before 
.
and all of a sudden something fixed is more beautiful than if it had never been broken 
.
the old pieces now creating a new picture 
.
a picture of grace 
.
so i went back close to the window 
.
and touched the wall with one hand
.
holding pieces in the other
.
and added my plea 
.
“fix me Jesus”
.
“like you have so many times before”
.
and then i was off to the next church

no one lives with certainty 
.
they choose to live with faith 
.
trust 
.
matthew 11:1-6

it snagged my heart when he said it 
.
first because it is a line from one of my all time most favorite movies 
.
field of dreams
.
(which if you haven’t seen yet…our friendship is currently on probation)
.
and second because it was so darling 
.
and third because i think he was right 
.
you see, i was touring one of the temple open houses 
.
if you have never been to one before, you get to move room to room and get a peak at everything before they start using the temple for actual temple things 
.
during the open house weeks, anyone who wants to come can come 
.
(that could preach 💛)
.
for part of the tour we got to a room that symbolizes the presence of God 
.
a celestial heavenly room 
.
there are big fancy crystal chandeliers 
.
vases that give you anxiety if you have kids near them 
.
and the fluffiest carpet on the earth 
.
the kind that tempts you to take off your shoes
.
high society kind of stuff 
.
as i stood by the door, a kid walked in with his dad 
.
right when the doors opened he said 
.
“woh!”
.
and then looked around wide eyed 
.
and then looked up at his dad and asked
.
“is this heaven?”
.
then i saw the dad look around 
.
maybe to check and see if it was
.
and it made me look around too 
.
every other time i have been in a room like that i see people all dressed in white 
.
a symbol that i actually love
.
all alike unto God 
.
each person washed clean by the blood of Jesus 
.
clothed in grace
.
but this time i saw something different 
.
another symbol
.
i saw a patchwork of humanity 
.
button ups and beanies
.
ties and t-shirts 
.
in all their variety 
.
giving beauty
.
anyone who wanted to come…
.
all different looking 
.
and all different living 
.
different pasts 
.
different paths 
.
all leading here 
.
from the four corners of the world
.
filling the four corners of the room 
.
and i saw a dad look around 
.
with dad eyes
.
and a dad heart 
.
at every cushion filled 
.
standing room only
.
a picture of His hope 
.
and the reason for all He does 
.
and i heard the other dad pull his kid close and say 
.
“yeah. i think it is”
.
and so did i
.
and not because of the carpet

lots you could call yourself
.
lots you could assume He would call you…
.
but try this one on
. 
it’s good news

i guess my kids see right through me 
.
and i thought i was so sneaky 
.
until jones called me out 
.
cause caleb asked if we could go to the ninja turtle movie 
.
and i said my go to line
.
the one i learned in dad school
. 
“i’ll think about it”
.
jones didn’t even look up from what he was doing 
.
and gave his quick quip to caleb:
.
“that means ‘no’ in dad talk”
.
and apparently so does “maybe”
.
and “ask me tomorrow”
.
and now i am busted 
.
and also wondering 
.
if God doesn’t have “dad talk”
.
sometimes it sounds like He does 
.
when someone follows up their prayers or blessings or comments in sunday school with—according to His will 
.
sounds like something jones would call out 
.
as a nice way to say “probably not”
.
or “maybe”
.
but He isn’t a dad like me 
.
and we didn’t go to the same school
.
and there is something i learned from the cross and the tomb 
.
in that time of three days in between 
.
it’s this 
.
God’s will is that God will 
.
He has no maybes 
.
except for maybe not how we thought 
.
or maybe not how we hoped
.
but for sure better 
.
and for sure someday 
.
cause He isn’t thinking about it 
.
He is working on it
.
cause it is sure to come 
.
even if it’s on a tomorrow 
.
or the next day
.
cause His will is sure 
.
and His will is good 
.
and His will is that He will 
.
He has already decided 
.
the only thing in question is me
.
in the waiting 
.
cause i could think the waiting is delaying 
.
and i can either worry 
.
or i can worship
.
and trust 
.
and wonder at what He might do!
.
and expect the very best
.
cause someday He will 
.
He promised 
.
and that is His kind of dad talk 
.
the kind you want to think about

jack sent me a pic one of his last nights in the mtc 
.
a handful of the boys from our @hxp.humanitarianexperience trip got to be in the mtc together 
.
it gave me all the feels
.
two pics… two years apart 
.
one in a muddy field in fiji 
.
the other in another field 
.
one that is white already to harvest 
.
trading their shovels in for scriptures 
.
same work
.
same group of boys 
.
changed by love two years ago 
.
and in two years from now, no doubt will be changed by love again

not sure who had the idea
.
but it’s terrible 
.
at least it makes me feel terrible 
.
some yahoo over at apple decided to put stats on everyone’s phone 
.
stats that tell you how often you use it each week 
.
how often you check in 
.
how obsessed you are
.
mine came in this morning 
.
“your usage was up 22%…”
.
i know, i know, i’m addicted. i get it 
.
it was probably my kids playing games…
.
but stats don’t lie
.
first thing in the morning 
.
last thing at night 
.
by some counts, a million times a day in between 
.
and it got me thinking 
.
and a memory popped up
.
(i actually like how iphones do that!)
.
it was a conversation a few were having
.
about their phone wallpaper 
.
the picture people choose to see every time they pick it up 
.
the image that is there for just a moment 
.
but again and again and again
.
they all wanted to see what picture each had picked
.
because each picture had a story 
.
as it went around it got to this one girl
.
and she showed her cracked screen 
.
and there was a picture of Jesus 
.
someone asked why
.
she said, “oh i don’t know…i really like it…and i check my phone so much i thought it would be good to see Him every time i did”
.
🥹💛
.
she kept going…
.
”i just want Him to be the center of my life”
.
intrigued, the same person asked a follow up
.
“why do you choose Jesus to be the center of your life?”
.
she looked down again at her phone
.
at Him
.
then looked back up and said, “well, i guess it’s because He made me the center of His”
.
my heart melted
.
it melted with the kind of love Jesus has
.
the kind of love that puts me in the center 
.
the kind where i am certain i am on His lock screen too
.
first thing in the morning 
.
last thing at night
.
kind of addicted 
.
in the good way
.
checked in on again and again and again 
.
by some counts, a million times a day

What worry weighs you down?

Is there something heavy on your heart?

Are you looking for an answer? For reassurance? For a nudge this way or that?

Today, spend some time in prayer, laying these things down at the feet of Jesus—leaning on His promise—ask and you shall receive.

Then spend this weekend listening, ready for His whisper, His gentle touch, and His surge of hope and healing.

most people do cinnamon rolls 
.
or crepes
.
but i do closets 
.
or garages 
.
my conference tradition is to clean something out 
.
not because of anything spiritual 
.
but because of my attention span 
.
and my backsides inability to sit that long 
.
so i pop in an airpod and just have a two for one 
.
at least i usually do 
.
but today we have 72 football and cheer games to go to 
.
and since everyone has to be there a fortnight early, we are at the fields for about 181 hours 
.
which means i might not have time for the clean out 
.
cause you see, i can’t start a project without finishing it 
.
it’s not in my spirit 
.
i hate having things hanging over my head 
.
unfinished 
.
especially clean outs since they get disastrous before they ever get better
.
and i just need them done
.
finished
.
checked off 
.
just how i am
.
so i don’t even want to start 
.
and i’m trying not to let that personality quirk slip into my faith 
.
cause faith isn’t a task 
.
and you don’t check things off 
.
or finish it quick 
.
and how sad to not even start if you can’t get it right 
.
or right away 
.
relationships aren’t like that 
.
they don’t have quotas or checkboxes or time limits 
.
i won’t forget a teenage girl i heard speaking from a church pulpit
.
after she spent a few minutes telling us what she believed, she ended with this line 
.
“and that’s my testimony for now”
.
for now…
.
that doesn’t work with garages for me, but i love it for faith
.
it’s what i believe for now
.
it’s what i can do for now
.
it’s where i am…for now 
.
even the flip side
.
these are my doubts and questions and struggles…for now
.
not quite done 
.
but not disappointing
.
unfinished and ok 
.
a wonderful work in progress
.
in her beliefs
.
in her practices
.
in her journey
.
her trust 
.
her experiences with Him
.
aware that there is more
.
hoping that there is more
.
and finding the courage or heart reason to continue 
.
but good with where she made it to 
.
and happy she has started
.
even if it was that messy part before it gets better 
.
at least for now

brick by brick 
.
wherever 
.
and whenever 
.
and at whatever cost
.
this is our God

i won’t ever forget the way the words caught in his throat
.
or the lesson God whispered in my ear as i stood there 
.
behind bars 
.
with the men dressed in prison scrubs 
.
scriptures open 
.
hearts too
.
it’s hard to describe the air in there
.
grace and hope and mercy so thick you feel like you are still covered in it when you leave 
.
we were teaching the story of jacob
.
the runaway kid from the book of genesis 
.
in his early days before he became israel
.
when he found himself out in the desert 
.
sleeping on rocks
.
no where to go
.
no home to return back to
.
how could he after what he had done
.
so there he was
.
lost
.
in a mess of his own making 
.
“serves you right” is what comes to mind as you read the story 
.
make your bed. lie in it. 
.
you deserve the rocks 
.
and yet God still came 
.
to a boy you wouldn’t think he would
.
in a place you wouldn’t expect 
.
and not with an “i told you so” in hand, but with a ladder to get him out 
.
and a promise to never leave him 
.
He met him there 
.
unearned 
.
undeserved
.
you wouldn’t think it
.
not with what you may have been taught 
.
but He still came to the boy in trouble 
.
and that’s when the man in the back of the class said it 
.
with a tear running down his cheek
.
the emotion piggybacking on his words 
.
“just like He meets us in here”
.
undeserved
.
unexpected 
.
but not unnoticed
.
and then heavens confirming whisper to me 
.
“God meets people where they are, not where they are supposed to be”
.
i believe in holy places 
.
and yearning to get yourself there
.
to meet the God of israel 
.
but i also believe in the God of jacob 
.
who meets people who haven’t quite made it 
.
and brings ladders to get them there
.
i learned that from genesis and from an inmate on the back row
.
in a prison that became a temple 
.
for that moment at least 
.
because He was there 
.
where we were

we don’t live FOR the good life 
.
we just LIVE the good life 
.
for me… (and president nelson :) 
.
eternal life is as much a gift of the present as it is of the future
.
the best things of heaven are the best things of earth
.
so enjoy them 
.
right now
.
p.s. that’s the whole vibe of the RVVL (revival) podcast (which started season 2 this week!!)
.
the one liners from conference that help us live that good life now
.
come celebrate the good news
.
be revived
.
25 minutes every tuesday morning on all your favorite podcast platforms 
.
just search “revival”
.
and that is what you will find :)

image_entities.entity: if it's ever between me & another bitch
choose her. i got better shit to do.

social_posts.post_text:
i had my doubts 
.
everyone seemed so hyped about an eclipse happening in utah today 
.
signs on the freeway said to expect 300,000 extra people for it 
.
for an eclipse??
.
don’t they only last like 2 minutes or something?
.
and is anything on this earth worth extra traffic?
.
like anything…
.
but i will admit 
.
the eclipse was way cooler than i thought it would be 
.
but only if you had those old 3D movie space glasses 
.
(p.s. wondering if there is a market for more fashionable eclipse glasses…you could make a killing once every 22 years or how ever often it happens)
.
the shadows were a little wonky in a rad way
.
and it cooled down a little bit i think
.
but other than that you would’ve never known it was happening 
.
and that was the coolest part 
.
95% (give or take—i’m not a weather man) of the sun was covered and you wouldn’t have ever known
.
all it took was a little bit to light up the world 
.
just a sliver of the Sun was all we needed 
.
and that started preaching 
.
cause i thought of the woman on the roadside 
.
desperate for help for 12 years 
.
and a simple brush up against Jesus changed it all 
.
just her fingertips 
.
and i remember the dad who came with his troubled boy
.
to ask Jesus if He could do anything 
.
cause he knew that any small thing from Him would matter 
.
and the fishermen on the boat 
.
caught in a wild storm 
.
until they whispered His name 
.
when it all felt too much 
.
and too big
.
all it took was just a little bit of Jesus 
.
so if you are in a place of dark storm 
.
or without hope
.
or feel to far 
.
remember all you need is a little bit of Jesus 
.
a sliver of the Son
.
cause even a whisper of His name 
.
or a brush up against Him 
.
or any small thing can bring His power
.
His presence 
.
His grace 
.
His hope 
.
His healing 
.
just a little bit of Jesus can bring His light 
.
and apparently it’s all you need
.
to make all the difference 
.
a difference you’ll notice right away

i can’t help looking through old pictures 
.
of lands and peoples i love so dearly 
.
i haven’t said much about what’s happening over there 
.
but i am so sad 
.
about so much
.
and i am also hopeful
.
cause i’ve stood in places that were once dark 
.
and beauty is there from ashes 
.
i am not an expert
.
but i am a brother 
.
and a dad
.
and a son
.
and a sibling 
.
a neighbor
.
and a friend 
.
and that’s the kind of heart my prayers are coming from 
.
come, Lord Jesus, come 
.
whether in person or overwhelming presence of Spirit
.
soften hearts 
.
multiply love
.
breathe in peace

i am a dreamer 
.
at night and in the day 
.
and even if i take a 20 minute power nap i get a dream 
.
my head just likes to dream i guess
.
lucky me 
.
but my dreams at night are usually my favorite 
.
oh the places i go
.
they are straight wild 
.
not just the places. but the whole dream 
.
everything
.
and sometimes 
.
once in a while 
.
i get a dream that feels so real
.
like the other night 
.
i dreamt i was with jack 
.
as a missionary 
.
i was there but not really
.
just getting to watch 
.
he was in the house of a cowboy
.
doing missionary things i guess
.
and the cowboy said with his head hanging down
.
“i really want to follow Jesus”
.
“i’m just not very good at it”
.
then elder jack put his arm around him and said with all the sincerity of his sweet, matter of fact soul 
.
“oh that’s ok”
.
“you rope steer don’t you?”
.
the cowboy nodded 
.
“you didn’t start very good at that either”
.
“but you kept trying”
.
“and eventually you got it”
.
“that’s what matters”
.
“and that’s what matters to Jesus”
.
then the cowboy lifted his head
.
and i saw hope in his eyes 
.
and i had tears in my own 
.
because of the message 
.
and the missionary who knew 
.
and i woke up with real tears 
.
and as i wiped them away i wanted the whole thing to be real 
.
the chance to hang with jack of course 
.
but more than that 
.
that he really knows and believes that about Jesus 
.
i wanted that that to be real
.
i think it is
.
i hope it is 
.
for him and everyone i know 
.
cause that would be a dream come true

some might not believe it 
.
but i do 
.
i read yesterday that americans spend over $12 billion on halloween each year
.
that’s 12 with a “b”
.
some of that is in the candy of course 
.
money well spent 
.
except for the people who buy tootsie rolls
.
i cannot support you
.
or those little strawberries that no one actually knows where to buy 
.
i cannot support you either but i am proud of you for finding the source 
.
but most of the money is spent on costumes 
.
for kids, of course, who change their minds every 2 days 
.
and now pet costumes are at an all time high (God bless you i cannot approach this topic)
.
and there are some of us adults who get into it too 
.
i will save all of my costume fails for another post on another day 
.
but i’ve had some doozies 
.
like the time i dressed up as a legit bedouin shepherd (it was so good!) and everyone thought i came to the party as Jesus 
.
classic…the religion teacher who came as Jesus…
.
fail
.
i shouldn’t have carried around the sheep…
.
i am actually surprised i am not better at costumes 
.
because i’m pretty good at them every other time 
.
i hide behind masks 
.
i put on the costumes people want 
.
i pretend
.
i yearn to be someone else
.
i often think…i wish i didn’t…
.
i wish i wasn’t so…
.
i wish i was more like…
.
yep…
.
i should be good at it
.
because i hide behind things all the time 
.
even before God
.
i just don’t dare admit it to Him
.
the real me
.
i’m ashamed of what He might think 
.
and what if stops loving me when He finds out the truth
.
as if He can’t see through it all
.
and what if He is disappointed…
.
i couldn’t disappoint Him
.
not after all He has done…
.
but you know what?
.
He isn’t
.
He isn’t disappointed 
.
or ashamed 
.
or embarrassed of me
.
the real me
. 
in fact i’ve learned something important 
.
God can’t bless who we pretend to be
.
but He wants to bless who we are
.
so put on your mask on halloween and get some candy
.
even those little strawberries
.
but take it off when you knock on God’s door
.
and be welcomed, embraced, and helped just as you are

if it is unkind
.
or impatient 
.
or not dripping with love 
.
it’s not God 
.
titus 3:3-4

i don’t know who is going to do it 
.
but one of you should sign up
.
and make the rest of us a checklist
.
a collection of all the things that kids should know to be an adult
.
like what temperature to wash whites in 
.
and how to get a credit card 
.
and get an emissions test
.
and to vote 
.
cause sometimes i worry i didn’t check everything off 
.
that the kids aren’t getting and knowing what they are supposed to or whatever 
.
and that spills into church stuff too
.
where the worry is a little more
.
jack emailed the other day with a question 
.
a church one
.
a deep one about the purpose of suffering 
.
and the character of God 
.
and why bad things happen 
.
you know the kind 
.
and then he said this 
.
i just don’t what to say the answer is
.
or how to explain it
.
but i am sure it is Jesus 
.
and i sighed a sigh of relief 
.
cause at least he got that 
.
he knows where to look 
.
and where to turn
.
in those times when he just doesn’t know how
.
one thing will be sure 
.
Jesus 
.
✅

it’s a wild promise 
.
even more wild that He is willing to keep it
.
cause if i knocked on @taylorswift or the white house door i don’t think they would open (even though i think taylor would be more likely)
.
but God says He will
.
the most powerful, influential, richest person in all the universe is insistent we know 
.
if you need help…just ask

my questions can paint a picture of His heart that simply isn’t true 
.
because He already showed it
.
He proved His heart 
.
so when things are confusing 
.
or seemingly contradictory
.
or questions are unanswered 
.
i will view what i don’t know in the light of what i do

image_entities.entity: it was the next best thing to a real visit!

social_posts.post_text:
i already know you are going to want to see it 
.
but i can’t
.
i won’t 
.
it’s that bad 
.
see several years ago jenny and i lived in hawaii 
.
and one day we decided to have a water coloring date on the beach 
.
so we got those cheapy water color trays from walmart and some paper and began our masterpieces 
.
a nice coconut or a palm tree would probably have been a good idea for my first try at any kind of art 
.
but instead i went for the gold and water colored a portrait 
.
and not just any portrait
.
i painted Jesus 
.
and i can never show you 
.
not necessarily because of embarrassment 
.
but i’m afraid you would stop believing 
.
it’s that level bad
.
but i kept it for all these years
.
and several months ago while cleaning out some things in the office, it slipped out of a book
.
jack was in the office and got an uninvited peek and said, “ew. what is that?”
.
notice his question was not a “who” but a “what”
.
and i squared my shoulders and proudly said, “it’s Jesus”
.
to which jack quickly replied, “nope. that’s not my Jesus”
.
and it’s made me think ever since 
.
i wonder how many people are walking around with the wrong picture of Jesus
.
not wrong about His looks, but the wrong idea about His heart 
.
perhaps someone painted Him wrong for them 
.
in church 
.
or at home 
.
or in passing comment
.
but in scripture we see Him as He really is 
.
so if the picture you have of Him isn’t wildly kind to those who make mistakes
.
or anxiously finding ways to include the outcast 
.
or shocking you with His mercy 
.
or surprisingly tender and patient with those who struggle to believe 
.
or down in the dirt with sinners
.
or calling disciples that have no business being there
.
or handing out second chances with each new day
.
or leaving a trail of people behind Him believing in something better about themselves 
.
or tears in His eyes over your broken heart—no matter who’s fault it was
.
or mighty and anxious to save anyone, anywhere, in any way 
.
seventy times seven times seven times seven
.
if that is not the picture you have of Him
.
i just might say to you
.
that’s not my Jesus 
.
it’s time for a new painting

words on repeat…
.
after a mistake
.
when i see i’m not quite there
.
each new day
.
thank you elder ballard 
.
they were so needed
.
“that’s ok. i’m doing the best i can”
-m. russell ballard

i heard we are to thank abe lincoln for the official holiday 
.
but gratitude was God’s idea 
.
and it makes sense 
.
because it must hurt His heart to send His kids away from home 
.
to a world filled with fear 
.
and sorrow 
.
and loss 
.
things that can so easily arrest our heart 
.
and lead us to forget who He is 
.
and stop believing that He cares 
.
and begin to wonder if we just might be on our own 
.
and so He built in a safeguard 
. 
a password into His presence 
.
if just for a moment 
.
a chance to sit in the goodness of God 
.
today 
.
because even though we trust and hope in happily ever after 
.
our hearts need to feel His adoration before then 
.
to feel that He is nearby 
.
to see His hand on a tuesday afternoon 
.
to have evidence of His all compassionate heart 
.
and to let that confirmation melt away our doubts and worries 
.
and start to sew back up the pieces of our heart 
.
so if you feel distant 
.
or are treading the waters 
.
or need to feel the touch of Love on your cheek 
.
you already have the key 
.
to a door that is never locked 
.
the quickest way to heaven 
.
thank you

how do i still get butterflies after all these years?
.
21 down. lots and lots to go!
.
(i know. i know. how did this guy land that girl? still a mystery…)

remember that little rhyme
.
with the church and the steeple and here are the people
.
i like the part where you wiggle your fingers 
.
but otherwise i don’t believe in it 
.
cause it taught me wrong
.
see i always hear people say 
.
“i wish the church would…”
.
“why doesn’t the church…”
.
“the church is so…”
.
fill in the blank
.
but see that’s the thing 
.
what if the church wasn’t the folded hands with the steeple 
.
what if the church was actually on the inside
.
wiggling
.
the people
.
what if “I” was the church 
.
think about it
.
most folks’ experience with church isn’t with an organization chart 
.
or a press release
.
it’s down the street 
.
so if i wish “the church” would be more kind, or more welcoming, or more this or that 
.
well …then it can be
.
cause i can be 
.
and if i wish the church spent more time or money or attention on that or this 
.
well it can do that too
.
if i do 
.
i can either wish the church was different 
.
or i can make a difference
.
cause the church isn’t four immovable brick walls
.
it’s thoughtfulness 
.
and listening
.
and creativity
.
and compassion 
.
and watchful care
.
and curiosity 
.
and a little bit of faithful whimsy
.
folded up in a million different hearts and hands
.
starting with wiggly old me
.
cause i am the church

what if a new story 
.
a start over 
.
a blessing and grace filled life with God 
.
weren’t going to require a mountain of change 
.
what if beginning is only six feet away

it was new for me
.
definitely a first timer 
.
because i’ve never cried over candy before 
.
at least until now 
.
it was one of those days…
.
where you aren’t sure if what you are doing is even moving the needle 
.
and you give yourself an F in every category 
.
but you keep it to yourself 
.
cause sometimes you just do 
.
and i got to my room 
.
on empty 
.
slid my backpack off my shoulders
.
and the weight didn’t leave 
.
and was about to collapse into bed when i saw it 
.
a peanut butter snickers bar 
.
the little fun size
.
one of my favorites 
.
that another one of my favorites had left on my pillow 
.
from his coveted halloween stash
.
just cause 
.
it didn’t take much 
.
from those little hands 
.
and a tear rolled down my cheek 
.
and i thought for that little moment
.
maybe  things would be ok 
.
and i also thought about that christmas verse i love so much 
.
about bethlehem 
.
“though thou be little” micah says 
.
from a little book in the back of the bible
.
to a forgotten little town
.
even though you’re small, you are going to do some big good some day 
.
when a little mom will come 
.
with a dad who has little in his pockets 
.
and under the light of a little star 
.
a little baby’s cry will break the silence of the night 
.
and hope will be born
.
and love will fill the story 
.
and the world will be promised something new and big 
.
that everything will be ok 
.
and for a moment they will all feel it
.
all from that little night 
.
in little bethlehem 
.
a little boy changed everything 
.
a story and lesson He keeps continuing 
.
through some of us 
.
and reminding us 
.
that though thou be little 
.
you can do things big 
.
and change things for better 
.
one little fun size moment at a time

i already know your favorite part before i even tell you the story 
.
see i met some of my heroes last night 
.
didn’t even know of them before yesterday, but i rushed to shake their hands after i heard the story 
.
twenty five years ago, after they retired, they decided to take a trip to mexico 
.
it was christmas time 
.
and it was the first time in their life they realized some kids wouldn’t get a toy on the morning of the 25th
.
and that just couldn’t be
.
not on their watch 
.
so together they decided to make them 
.
to create a satellite office of the north pole in west jordan, utah 
.
they didn’t have wood, skills, or money
.
but they did have love 
.
and apparently that is enough 
.
especially when mixed with the right amount of creativity 
.
so if they couldn’t buy wood for the toys they would find it 
.
in dumpsters 
.
when they found their one, he cradled his hands and helped hoist his 65 year old wife’s leg over the front edge
.
in she went 
.
where she rummaged for scraps to make their first little toy cars 
.
and leaving just enough garbage on the inside to stack up and stand on to get a leg back over 
.
told you i knew your favorite part
.
and so they went from dumpster to dumpster 
.
and then eventually helper to helper
.
from their two car garage 
.
to now a warehouse full of volunteers 
.
for twenty five years 
.
until today 
.
where they have collectively carved, sanded, and painted…by hand…and then given over 1.5 million toys 
.
from alabama to argentina 
.
and this coming monday morning 
.
they’ll hobble back into the shop 
.
until every kid has a smile 
.
tonight i heard him say 
.
with a twinkle in his eyes 
.
once you give your life away 
.
well that’s when you’ve found it 
.
i’ve heard those words before 
.
from a hero of both of ours
.
and some day i’ll get to meet Him again 
.
but in the mean time 
.
i got to meet them
.
and they reminded me of Him
.
and what He came to do 
.
turn trash to treasure 
.
to give away His life 
.
to put a smile on the world 
.
it’s no surprise when i took their hands they they felt like His might
.
weathered and worn
.
the work of The Carpenter

a messy story doesn’t intimidate Jesus 
.
it’s the very reason He comes 
.
that’s what the first christmas taught us

i can’t remember when i found out the truth 
.
that everyone was lying about christmas 
.
the true story that wasn’t so true
.
i’m talking about the wisemen 
.
who apparently didn’t show up until two years after Jesus was born 
.
two years!
.
at least that’s what the smart bible people say
.
they weren’t there the night in the stable
.
they didn’t come and park their camels right outside and kneel down in the straw with their frankincense 
.
they followed the star 
.
and it took years
.
yet on every shelf in my house 
.
in wood, plastic, and glass
.
and in every christmas eve reading of luke 2
.
and in every church program 
.
they be tricking 
.
cause right after the shepherds come with neckties around their foreheads, the other kids walk in right after wearing bathrobes holding gifts
.
same night
.
and in every nativity scene you set them up right next to the donkey 
.
same scene 
.
as if they were there 
.
and tonight as i sat looking at my shelf full of wisemen with shepherds 
.
i decided i liked this version of the story better 
.
it shows an aspect of His heart you wouldn’t see if they weren’t there in the same scene 
.
cause that’s who Jesus is 
.
someone who brings everyone 
.
all together 
.
close by and far away 
.
familiar and foreigner 
.
those who keep company with angels 
.
and those who only have a glimmer of belief high in the sky 
.
He sees them all the same
.
and they are welcome all the same 
.
and that “first night” He made sure we all knew loud and clear that everyone had a place 
.
outsiders and insiders alike
.
no room in the inn
.
but plenty in the stable
.
pack them in He said
.
even that donkey
.
and even if it takes you a little longer to get there 
.
two years even
.
or more
.
you still have a place right next to the baby 
.
as if you were there the night it happened 
.
yep, it took me a while to learn the truth about christmas 
.
but so very happy i did

here are a few of my favorite things…
.
(p.s. this is the sound of music meadow…so get it?)
.
she has a heart wide enough for anyone to have a place 
.
she believes quietly, but fiercely 
.
she is devoted to all things that are good 
.
she is beautiful 
.
her eyes are stunning 
.
and her legs…my word
.
but her soul is breathtaking
.
she is gracious with your mistakes 
.
she is confident in those things that matter 
.
and it’s contagious
.
because she has a presence that settles 
.
she makes you remember
.
she allows a curious wander 
.
but holds a place for you to return to the steady 
.
she is strong 
.
legit i’ve seen her power clean 
.
but to those of who know her, you know what i actually mean 
.
and to those of you who don’t, you are lucky 
.
because one of your favorite days are ahead of you 
.
but i’ll give you a sneak peek 
.
she has flushed red cheeks right now reading this post 
.
doesn’t think half of it is true 
.
and refuses the attention
.
which is another one of my favorite things 
.
and she’ll roll her eyes when i make a comment about her aging like a fine wine 
.
a quick roll 
.
but just enough to send her message
.
not because of the aging part (even though she is older than me) she has embraced that 
.
but because i will then make a comment about wanting to drink said wine 
.
and she will not be ruffled by my inappropriateness 
.
she will carry on 
.
like a queen 
.
loving me all the same 
.
and perhaps more 
.
waiting for me to catch up
.
oh man…how’d i get so lucky 
.
she is my favorite 
.
love you lady 
.
happy birthday 
.
cheers

merry christmas darling!
.
with every good wish,
the butlers

i am of the angel variety
.
always have been 
.
christmas cannot be contained 
.
i want to fill the sky 
.
break the boundary between heaven and earth
.
shout and praise and everything over the top 
.
in excelsis Deo!
.
but a part of me is thinking different this year 
.
maybe it’s that boy of mine
.
with Jesus on his heart 
.
maybe he’s distracting me in the good way 
.
cause he is living a different kind of Christmas 
.
a shepherd’s Christmas 
.
not worse 
.
just different 
.
cause they were both there
.
shepherds and angels 
.
and kings too 
.
and maybe the story is told that way to remind us that we can have all of them
.
perhaps together in the same year 
.
but something about this year is tilting me more toward the shepherd fields 
.
my friend pointed out to me this week the word “abiding” in their story 
.
it’s now highlighted on my heart
.
abiding in the fields 
.
waiting 
.
watching 
.
maybe worrying 
.
about this or that
.
perhaps that’s you this year 
.
an abiding year
.
and you look around and see the fanfare 
.
the triumph of the skies 
.
and you listen to it all 
.
it is so good
.
and it tickles your soul
.
but your moment will come silently 
.
kneeling in the straw 
.
before a baby in the manger
.
just little 
.
and sweet
.
settled for a moment
.
leaving the world and its worries behind 
.
knowing God came down
.
no miracle quite yet 
.
no song to sing
.
but now you have the melody
.
no change
.
but everything different 
.
the hint of things to come 
.
no, better
.
the promise of things to come 
.
that’s the shepherd’s Christmas 
.
cause you will go back to the fields
.
to tending 
.
and keeping watch 
.
and it may look the same as before
.
but now with a little more hopeful expectation 
.
the wonders of his love gently stirring inside 
.
knowing that baby will grow up
.
and the angels will come back
.
and joy will fill the world 
.
and until then 
.
abiding 
.
waiting
.
keeping watch over your little flock 
.
gently humming the song you’ll one day get to sing
.
merry christmas

i hope you are feeling the same 
.
no clue what day or hour it is 
.
that free fall in between christmas and new years 
.
where you don’t know who you are or what you stand for
.
and showers are optional 
.
and you survive on leftover cookies 
.
and cough drops 
.
and you slowly…
.
or with reckless abandon 
.
put away christmas 
.
and even though it cleanses the soul to clear your shelves 
.
you have a hint of hesitancy 
.
as i wrap up each piece i think about mary and joseph and the baby
.
on that first christmas
.
when it was over
.
and how they had to leave the manger
.
leave christmas behind and move on
.
it wasn’t anything like they thought it would be
.
nothing about it went as expected
.
but what was disappointing and dirty turned into something divine
.
when Jesus came 
.
that first christmas night turned spectacular, sacred and story worthy
.
it was filled with wonder and angels and miraculous beginnings
.
that stable became such a beautiful memory for that little family
.
but the morning came and they had to leave
.
they had to move on with the story
.
the overwhelm of a newborn 
.
the taxes still due
.
a flight for their lives
.
refugees in a foreign land
.
then back to the hometown with a reputation no one forgot 
.
so it may have seemed nice to stay in the stable
.
to just sit in the majesty of that morning
.
because what was ahead was unknown and uncertainty 
.
fear
.
perhaps pain
.
but maybe they could remember that’s how christmas started 
.
but it’s not how it ended 
.
and more was coming 
.
more wonder and more majesty and more miracles
.
more healing and hope and more heaven poured out
.
it brought more Jesus 
.
so i will leave christmas too
.
and step into my new unknown
.
however it may look 
.
i will hold tight to those memories
.
but also look forward with joyful anticipation for the good things to come
.
because Jesus will be there
.
he is the one thing certain in the uncertain
.
and when we have Jesus, the wonders never stop and the magic keeps going
.
but just for good measure, i’m going to live in limbo for just a few more hours 
.
sitting the straw 
.
and eat another chocolate covered pretzel from my neighbor

he meant to say something else
.
but i like what he actually said better 
.
my friend this week was asking me if i was a goal making kinda guy 
.
i’m not really 
.
i’m too indecisive to settle on them 
.
and the commitment level is too high for my ADD 
.
when i told him “no” he replied with what i think was the consolation for the uncommitted 
.
“no worries. it’s gonna be a God year”
.
it made me stop
.
and forget my non-goal guilt
.
what a happy prophecy 
.
he meant to say “good”
.
but the sermon came in the typo 
.
(cause the best lessons are born of mistakes anyways)
.
and we both liked it better 
.
a God year 
.
a year of His wisdom 
.
and blessing 
.
and tutoring 
.
and forgiveness 
.
and grace 
. 
and presence
.
that’s the kind of year i want 
.
a God year
.
one done together 
.
something i could actually commit to 
.
Him 
.
and then recommit to…
.
cause that’s part of what a God year is too
.
do overs 
.
and try agains
.
and agains
.
got me excited 
.
for all of it
.
and I think He is too 
.
it’s gonna be good

our favorite new year tradition 
.
it felt better than throwing them away 
.
here’s how it works:
.
pick a card 
.
any card
.
.
pray a prayer
.
it gives us a chance to pray over our family and friends 
.
everyone gets included every night…generally 
.
but this gives us a chance to love and remember each of our friends and families through the year 
.
let me know if you start doing it 
.
and i’ll send you our card 😉💛

just thought i’d borrow someone else’s goal 
.
seemed like a good one

i heard it said of a man i admire 
.
a good, good man we said goodbye to today 
.
and far too early than we should’ve…
.
and it’s something i hoped would be said of me on my last day 
.
“he was a doting father”
.
always there 
.
front row
.
first call
.
through all of it 
.
and it made me think of God
.
and how He is just the same 
.
doting
.
over each of us
.
and how i’ve sensed that the last few days 
.
i sensed His smile at the cheer competition the other night 
.
how proud He must be of all of them
.
i sensed His worry as we talked with friends looking for work 
.
He has had as many sleepless nights as they have 
.
i thought i heard Him jump when we got our good news 
.
and sigh when it was needed
.
and i heard His heart break when grandkids said goodbye 
.
He is there
.
through every up
.
and through each down 
.
and every day in between 
.
the births 
.
the wins
.
the goodbyes 
.
the addictions
.
the new jobs 
.
the sick
.
the card games
.
giddy first dates
.
and awkward ones too 
.
and memories
.
and fears 
.
and flat tires
.
and parties
.
and funerals
.
and cake cutting 
.
and tire swings
.
all of it
.
front row
.
first call
.
living it all with us
.
the stretch of a life
.
the ever doting Father

if it makes you feel “less than”
i don’t think it’s the gospel
.
if it doesn’t fill you with hope and thrill 
i don’t think it’s the gospel 
.
the gospel is good news 
.
it should sound like it
.
it’s second chances 
it’s a way out 
a way home
a way better 
.
it is rejoicing 
it is fatted calves
it’s merry 
.
it is the good news

i wish i had been there 
.
even though i felt like i was after all the videos i saw 
.
but this one group i heard about got to see it in real life 
.
they weren’t a camera crew or the marketing team 
.
they are there most every night 
.
performing for all the tourists 
.
beat boxers 
.
one of my dream jobs…
.
and on one of those nights 
.
unexpectedly 
.
times square became a stable 
.
lit up with the scenes of that holy night 
.
scenes of the Holy One 
.
and a friend of mine overheard the beat boxers
